dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Michael Bloomberg thinks he could beat Trump, huh? You actually buy that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Michael Bloomberg thinks he could beat Trump, huh? You actually buy that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I believe I would defeat Donald Trump in a general election, Bloomberg wrote in an editorial posted to his eponymous news site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, he believes he could, yeah. And, like, he says he would've easily won the Democratic nomination too if he'd run.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, he believes he could, yeah. And, like, he says he would've easily won the Democratic nomination too if he'd run.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But I am clear-eyed about the difficulty of winning the Democratic nomination in such a crowded field.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Easily? Come on. With that crowded field? That's just, like, pure ego talking, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Easily? Come on. With that crowded field? That's just, like, pure ego talking, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but he's, uh, he's clear-eyed about the difficulty. He just felt he could do it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but he's, uh, he's clear-eyed about the difficulty. He just felt he could do it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But I am clear-eyed about the difficulty of winning the Democratic nomination in such a crowded field.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or he just didn't want to spend his personal funds on a primary, that's what a source said. So, he's too cheap for the primary but then he'd beat Trump? Makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or he just didn't want to spend his personal funds on a primary, that's what a source said. So, he's too cheap for the primary but then he'd beat Trump? Makes sense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's actually planning to spend five hundred million dollars to defeat Trump now, though. That's, like, a lot of money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's actually planning to spend five hundred million dollars to defeat Trump now, though. That's, like, a lot of money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, he plans to spend $500 million of his own money to defeat Trump, adding to the $100 million he spent on behalf of Democrats in the 2018 midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Five hundred million to defeat him, not to, you know, run himself. Big difference. Why not just, uh, run if he's so confident?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Five hundred million to defeat him, not to, you know, run himself. Big difference. Why not just, uh, run if he's so confident?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He said, he didn't want to split the anti-Trump vote, you know, like he criticized Howard Schultz for potentially doing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said, he didn't want to split the anti-Trump vote, you know, like he criticized Howard Schultz for potentially doing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In January, he obliquely criticized the possible candidacy of Howard Schultz, the billionaire founder of Starbucks, saying that the great likelihood is that an independent candidate would just split the anti-Trump vote and end up reelecting the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so he's not running because he's selfless, not because he, uh, didn't want to deal with the primary heat? That's a convenient narrative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so he's not running because he's selfless, not because he, uh, didn't want to deal with the primary heat? That's a convenient narrative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he's also focusing on Beyond Carbon, this, like, clean energy initiative. He's funded it for years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he's also focusing on Beyond Carbon, this, like, clean energy initiative. He's funded it for years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In lieu of running, Bloomberg will devote the next two years to a new initiative, Beyond Carbon, a grassroots effort to begin moving America as quickly as possible away from oil and gas and toward a 100 percent clean energy economy. His foundation has already worked to shutter coal-fired power plants and reduce air pollution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. A decade-long passion project that, um, just coincidentally becomes his focus when he decides not to run for president despite thinking he could win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. A decade-long passion project that, um, just coincidentally becomes his focus when he decides not to run for president despite thinking he could win.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's really serious about fighting climate change. It's, like, a massive investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's really serious about fighting climate change. It's, like, a massive investment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, it's a massive way to stay relevant and, you know, wield influence without the actual scrutiny of a campaign.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, it's a massive way to stay relevant and, you know, wield influence without the actual scrutiny of a campaign.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But he's criticizing Republicans, too, saying they failed their constitutional duty to hold Trump accountable. That's, uh, pretty direct.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he's criticizing Republicans, too, saying they failed their constitutional duty to hold Trump accountable. That's, uh, pretty direct.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, also castigated congressional Republicans, who he says have failedand are still failingto fulfill their constitutional duty to hold the president accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, a former Republican criticizing Republicans. That's, um, certainly a take. What's his game here, really?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, a former Republican criticizing Republicans. That's, um, certainly a take. What's his game here, really?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, also castigated congressional Republicans, who he says have failedand are still failingto fulfill their constitutional duty to hold the president accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: His game? I mean, he seems genuinely concerned about the country, about Trump. He just wants a Democrat to win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: His game? I mean, he seems genuinely concerned about the country, about Trump. He just wants a Democrat to win.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the editorial, the former New York City mayor called Trump a threat to our country and emphasized the need to nominate a Democratic candidate who could beat him in the general election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, he just wants to be the kingmaker, pull the strings from the sidelines. Seems more like it to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, he just wants to be the kingmaker, pull the strings from the sidelines. Seems more like it to me.
